website_summaries.verdict: Although it's not technically a detergent, every cloth diaper is prone to urine, mineral, and detergent buildup. This option effectively removes set-in odors and residues that can affect absorption.
pros: Strips cloth diaper fibers of odor-causing buildup, mineral deposits, and detergent residue
Boosts absorbency and extends cloth diaper life
Works for all washing machine types
Packs are convenient and easy to use

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: My cloth diapers had gotten an ammonia smell that turned into a barnyard smell after washing so after some research I got these. I went to the GroVia website for the best advice on how to use them and chatted with a very helpful representative who advised me to treat my washed diapers three times (one packet in a hot wash, two cold rinse cylces) followed by a 1/4 cup diluted bleach cycle (same hot, two cold rinse). My diapers smell amazing now! She suggested treating them once every 6 weeks or so because I have hard water. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: debimustard

customer_reviews.title: No more ammonia smell!
customer_reviews.text: I filled my bathtub half way with hot water, into which I put three pods of mighty bubbles. They dissolved very quickly, leaving nothing undissolved. I left my clean cloth diapers in overnight, stirring a few times before I went to bed. The water was very satisfyingly dirty when I took the diapers out in the morning! I then put my diapers in my HE washer with a half a cup of bleach, then I did a rinse load, and then I washed with my detergent. My diapers no longer have a horrible smell immediately, and my baby is no longer red after wearing her cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca I

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cleaning power
customer_reviews.text: I read on facebook about people using this product to strip clothing not just diapers. We have very hard water and my husband is a welder/mechanic. The hard water and detergent are hard on clothes as is my husbands profession. One picture is a duvet cover that I thought was reuined from greasy dirty areas from my husbands neck and hands touching. I also included sheets that had been washed one week before the soak and looked clean. It is unbelievable the dirt and oil this product pulls out. Even when you think it is clean!We
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great to get detergent smell out of clothes
customer_reviews.text: Used these to strip clothes I bought at a resale that had a strong fragrance/soap smell. It worked like magic! Soaked them in laundry tub with 2 pods for 4 hours. The water turned so gross. Then washed them on a water only cycle & then washed again with soap. No more smell!!!
customer_reviews.author: cestlav

customer_reviews.title: Skip the complicated strip, all you need is Mighty Bubbles!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great for funky diapers. If you're totally stressed out and ready to give up on your stash, DON'T. This saved our cloth! We get hard water build up and the diapers need to be "stripped" every 5 months or so. Use this on clean diapers, 3 hot cycles in a row with one pod in each cycle for amazing bright refreshed diapers. Only one cycle has not been effective for us. Stripping can allow trapped bacteria to surface so follow up with a warm cycle with bleach to sanitize.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked on the first try
customer_reviews.text: I've tried these one time on my diapers because they were smelling terrible. We have hard water. I let these soak for a few hours instead of use in the washer. The water was murky and disgusting. I did a washer cycle after the soak and dried in the dryer. I have no problem with the smell now. Normally the diapers would smell fine coming out of the washer but as soon as I machine dried them the poop smell would be terrible. I had no poop smell out of the dryer after using the pods. I would definitely recommend to have these on hand just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: These work great! Thank goodness
customer_reviews.text: These work great! Thank goodness, because the idea of doing a strip in the bathtub was very daunting. After about a year of use I was starting to notice some kind of lingering smell, I wouldn't say it was ammonia or barnyard, but it was definitely something and I want my diapers to smell like nothing when they come out of the wash. This did the trick and now I do a preventative mighty bubbles cycle about once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Gets thrift store chemical odors out!
customer_reviews.text: I've avoided thrifting for years after failing to get the odor out of fabrics (I've tried every natural remedy found on the internet). This is the only way I've ever been able to get the Febreeze stink out of used clothes. The detergent has its own slight odor, but washes out after a couple of regular washes with my usual unscented Seventh Generation laundry soap. The scent of this treatment is nothing compared to the migraine inducing scent of Febreeze that is commonly used in thrift stores now and at least it goes away!
customer_reviews.author: Janel

customer_reviews.title: FOR SO MUCH MORE THAN DIAPERS!!
customer_reviews.text: I used these on our My Pilliows, my SO is a sweater and his pillow tends to get funky quickly- regular washing does not cure what Im talk about. I remembered using something like this when I clothed diapered, but these are definitely more washer friendly. I was hoping these would pull out whatever dried in funk inhabited his pillow... Sure enough, after 1 wash, his pillow has no smell and fluffed back up as if it were brand new! Now I am using these for all sorts of smells and stains (think uniforms sports gear, gym bags, .. the carpet?!?!). Will definitely be ordering again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defunk Diapers, Workout Clothes, Etc.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my husband's workout clothes and my baby's diapers. Workout Clothes: All of his dry-fit type clothing had gotten a real funky stench that I couldn't get rid of with detergent alone. I ran them in a couple rounds of this and they smell fresh and clean again. Diapers: Ran them in a couple rounds of this and they smell fresh and clean again. I also put them out in the sun to dry. After a year of use, they look and SMELL like new.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: These are the best so far
customer_reviews.text: I tried treating my daughter's diapers a few times with these pods and have yet to experience the "good as new" effect. They help the stench for maybe one or two uses. Mind you, we are following proper detergent protocol for regular washes. They certainly don't seem to improve absorbancy. Perhaps it's the tap water I'm using (water is very hard here in Mesa , Az) but I can't seem to find a solution otherwise. These are the best so far, but really not as helpful as I need them to be.
customer_reviews.author: BioTech Mommy

customer_reviews.title: So far, 100% success with just one use.
customer_reviews.text: I discovered I had to strip a bunch of stinky cloth diapers, which I'd never done before. There was a LOT of info out there, and a lot of products, so I figured I'd be going through lots of trial and error, figuring out the best way to do this. I decided to try one packet of GroVia Mighty Bubbles in my top-loader, with hot water, and one hot rinse. No lie, it took away 100% of that barnyard smell from the entire lot of diapers. More importantly, it took away 100% of any future guesswork and wasted time. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Brings back to Life !!!
customer_reviews.text: Filled tub with HOT water , 3 tabs of Grovia mighty bubble (per load) , and 4-6 hours later. Did 4 different loads , 2 darks , 1 lights and 1 towel. I soak them every 6 months to keep any smell, soap , buildup etc nonexistent. It truly is a life saver!!! Highly recommend to anyone we has athletes, sweaty gym clothes, law enforcement officers and microfiber towels. It is an over all phenomenal product !
customer_reviews.author: K.Price

customer_reviews.title: For stripping used cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to strip some used cloth diapers I bought. I had used Fluff Love’s old stripping instructions. Since then Fluff Love is no longer allowed to promote that stripping method because apparently GroVia asked them to stop. But the method worked great for me! The diapers I bought were completely stiff and had lost their absorbency because the previous owners had used lots of fabric softener. After I stripped them they were perfectly soft again and worked just fine. Unfortunately I’m not sure where to find the old stripping instructions anymore because Fluff Love has removed them from their website.
customer_reviews.author: NKJD

customer_reviews.title: Great For Stripping Diapers
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic, I have used these for stripping cloth diapers two times, once after months of dealing with a barnyard smell that I just couldn't get rid of, and just recently after trying a new detergent that ended up burning my son's skin. I used these to make sure all traces of the detergent were truly gone and my diapers are once again like new and my son's skin is happy. They are also super easy to use and you really can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Beth L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard water
customer_reviews.text: I have hard water in my apartment with laundry facilities on site, no in unit machines unfortunately. My clothes were starting to feel dirty even after I cleaned them and the armpit area of my shirts were absolutely disgusting. I never had this problem in my house before the apartment with the same clothes. I did a tub strip of all my main clothes (daunting and not recommended) and now I throw a pod or two in my regular wash about once a month. Removes all the residue from my clothing that normal cleaning doesn't get out.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had to strip my cloth diapers and these did the trick! I followed instructions from fluff love university .com and soaked my diapers in a bathtub with 3 of these packs for a few hours. Then rinsed, let them soak in bleach for 30 min and washed in tide detergent twice. I was having a stink problem, but not anymore! It's now been about 8 weeks and I plan to throw in a pack with my next load just as a "booster" to keep things nice and fresh. Great price here on amazon! My local cloth diaper retail store was charging about twice as much!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany HooksTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to remove amonia from our cloth diapers for years. I had to stop using them for the last two kids because I just could not remove the amonia and my kids were getting amonia burns. They are finally actually clean and we can stop buying disposables again! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Justine Arbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We have hard water so it's a constant battle to prevent buildup on our cloth diapers. I was ready to give up on cloth diapering until I found these. These tablets do a great job of stripping off all of the residue and give you fresh diapers. After the first initial stripping (3 cycles, 1 tab per cycle), I now only have to do one cycle every month or so and it freshens them right back up.
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: Easiest & Most Cost Effective Way To Strip Your Diapers
customer_reviews.text: We use this product every month or so to strip our cloth diapers when we feel they are getting buildup. Once your diapers are clean, you just throw one of these little pods in with the diapers and voila! Your diapers are stripped. We feel that they do the job just as well as any other method, and really like that GroVia has made them affordable. $1/per stripping session and as easy as popping it in the washing machine. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Katie B.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Works! No More Stink.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously works! My son’s cloth diapers were starting to get a barnyard stink to them so I did two washes with GroVia mighty bubbles (washed all diapers from clean/dry) and the diapers came out so nice and clean and no stink! The inserts and diapers even feel cleaner to the touch. Skip the crazy hard stripping routine and just use these. I even called the customer service number listed on the bag for a few questions and spoke to the nicest most helpful customer service rep. She was so knowledgeable and gave me great advice and really helped me with my wash routine.
customer_reviews.author: M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! Made my diapers clean as new!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing!! I did a full strip with 3 pods following the fluff love and CD science instructions and you should have seeeeeen the water!! So so so gross and smelt like such strong urine! And that was with CLEAN cloth diapers!! I plan to use these as a booster once a month now to really keep my diapers clean!
customer_reviews.author: Brittanye

customer_reviews.title: Gets the dirt out!
customer_reviews.text: Use them for stripping dirt out of really dirty laundry, towels, etc. Use one of these in a small bucket for single items with hot water and soak for 6ish hours with occasional stirring (3 of them for a full load of laundry in a large tub or in a washing machine). Then wash on a rinse cycle with no detergent, repeat the strip if necessary. Otherwise wash with detergent per usual. I can’t BELIEVE the grime these get out.
customer_reviews.author: birdlady

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: I had some pretty stale smelling cloth diapers. I tried soaking them in vinegar but it didn't help so I bought these and figured I'd try. I threw the clean diapers in the machine with one of these packets and followed directions. I did it twice just to make sure everything would be back to normal. My diapers don't have any lingering pee or ammonia smell so I'm saying these mighty bubble things worked!! Will definitely get more if needed
customer_reviews.author: Sydney/Steven

customer_reviews.title: Best Diaper Stripper!
customer_reviews.text: For awhile Amazon was Out of Stock on this brand and I put off ordering a diaper stripper hoping it would come back (Grovia website was sold out as well when I checked). As soon as I saw it was back in stock I added to my cart. This is the ONLY diaper stripper I'll use for my cloth diapers! Works great! I also really like that it comes in pod as opposed to a scoopable powder.
customer_reviews.author: PeteLab

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and got the soap build up out of our ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to strip our clothes after using homemade laundry detergent for 2 years. Worked great and got the soap build up out of our clothes. If you use homemade detergent, google why you shouldn't and buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cloth diapering product
customer_reviews.text: I have been cloth diapering for a couple years and every couple months I give them a thorough cleaning using the mighty bubble pods. This solution really helps break down any urine buildup and give them fresh life. I never have any issues with repelling or such after using this product on my diapers. This product is awesome for people who are cloth diapering or have a toddler who is potty training and still having accidents. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mtwilson

customer_reviews.title: This is literally the most amazing product. My scrub tops were all virtually destroyed ...
customer_reviews.text: Not just used for diapers!! This is literally the most amazing product. My scrub tops were all virtually destroyed from deodorant staining ruining the fabric in the armpit areas. This completely got all the white staining/crusts out!! No amount of regular washing has been able to do this. Now I don’t have to go out and buy new work clothes like I thought I was going to have to. I tried it on a few T-shirt’s too, and it worked beautifully! I’m so happy I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Beth A.

customer_reviews.title: I love grow via mighty bubbles
customer_reviews.text: I love grow via mighty bubbles. It is the only diapers diaper that I use I use it quarterly, every four months. I just use it exactly as the directions tell me to because we have hard water I have to strip my diapers every four months. It works great it take the ammonia smell out of my diapers. I'm not sure that I'll have her try a different Brand because this works so well and I have been using it for so long
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been cloth diapering for a little over a year, and hand me down diapers, these past couple of weeks when I put the diapers in the washer the ammonia would burn my nose hairs and after they were washed they would have a barnyard smell. I couldn’t find any real answers on how to get rid of it other than RLR but I bought this stuff because it was a Prime item and came with more for less $$ I wasn’t very hopeful and ready to switch to disposables. Threw one cube in the wash and BLAM like magic they’re good as new. Miracle pods for realsie
customer_reviews.author: Macee DePhilippis

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diapers are clean!
customer_reviews.text: I use cloth diapers and noticed that over time the diapers had an odor when they came out of the dryer. I decided to get these for a deep clean. I added 2 to a load of clean diapers (about 25 diapers and inserts) and let them go in the wash. No more smell! They restored them to clean feel and sent. Its important to note these are to be used on clean cloth diapers. It is not a substitute for a wash cycle
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth diaper washing routine
customer_reviews.text: This product took my pocket cloth diapers from barn yard smell to fresh and clean in three washes. Great value and a must buy. Don’t believe people who say you don’t need to strip cloth diapers- in 1.5 years I had only bleached mine three times, but it never got out the smell completely. I had a proper washing routine and even hung my diapers to dry, but the smell after 1.5 years of use told me I needed to strip them. Also, after stripping, the diapers feel cleaner and seem to absorb urine better. Also, I called customer service before using, and they picked up right away and were very friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Webb

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to strip our white towels that had become very dingy after using homemade laundry soap for the past 5-6 years. Soaked them in hot water with 3 of these, ran an extra rinse cycle, then washed them in Tide w/Bleach and they look and feel so much better now! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: I was having issues with ammonia buildup in my cloth ...
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with ammonia buildup in my cloth diapers which was giving my baby some redness on his scrotum. Yikes! I suspected the ammonia was due to detergent build up, but even after using less detergent and using RLR occasionally, the ammonia smell would come back after a couple of uses. I switched to using GroVia Mighty Bubbles once a month and haven't had any ammonia issues since.
customer_reviews.author: E. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Tad expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for deep cleaning 2x a month- otherwise I wouldn't use them for daily because of the price. I can buy free & clear powder for way cheaper to use on my grovia cloth diapers. I do feel that its necessary to clean with these every now and them, to keep the quality of the diaper up and to keep proper clean. The wrapping is much thicker than traditional pods... for that reason I place directly under water to ensure it pops open properly. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Not just for diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Use this to strip bed linens and mattress pads about once every 6 months or so. Works great to get out stains and residue that detergent alone may leave behind. I just drop a pack in my HE washer, set it for a heavy cycle with hot water and an extra rinse. Sheets come out clean as new.
customer_reviews.author: Dee E.

customer_reviews.title: Very effective, but pricey
customer_reviews.text: These work great to strip cloth diapers. I use them every couple months to keep my cloth diapers from getting a pungent urine smell. I wish they were less expensive, but they have been very effective and are much easier to use than stripping the diapers by repeated boiling - which is time consuming and hasn't work that well in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: ian bearup

customer_reviews.title: I used 4 pods to do a full bathtub load of prefolds (the instructions I followed called for 3 but I threw in an extra for good m
customer_reviews.text: Used these in the bathtub to strip cloth diapers that has hard water build up. I used 4 pods to do a full bathtub load of prefolds (the instructions I followed called for 3 but I threw in an extra for good measure.) The diapers came out great, build up completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: R Silvert

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful for keeping cloth diapers odor free
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have a proper wash routine for my cloth diapers due to being a newbie at it. I bought this and it really helped pull the stink out of them. Now I have a better wash technique and still use this twice a month to give my diapers a deep wash without stripping. Have not had an issue with bad odor since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped heal a sore bum
customer_reviews.text: Our little one had a rash that would not heal, we determined it was the diapers. We washed all her Grovia diapers and then rinsed with this laundry treatment per the instructions. The rash healed right away. We continue to use when we see a bit of a rash returning or if the diapers start to seem a little stinky/residue-y.
customer_reviews.author: ekg

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: my diapers got water repelent because I use A&D diaper rush oiment. They start to leak every single time. One cycle with this product was enough. Now they absorb as new again.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for both cloth diapers and for dish towels (I do not use paper towels, rather I use old dish towels and rags for cleaning in the kitchen). This product works very well on both types of laundry. The dish towels especially have a tendency to hold onto to a certain sour milk type smell, but after a wash with these pods, that smell is gone!
customer_reviews.author: Leana

customer_reviews.title: Great for funky towels too.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stripping must have. Cloth Mommas be like "I've been stripping all day & understand without the awkward glances. I digress, these did the job, my fluff stash no longer has lingering barnyard, ammonia smells anymore. Also used them on funky smelling towels and did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Lyssette S

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. I had some cloth diapers that had been washed in untreated hard water for years and were very smelly. It took 2-3 washes with the mighty bubbles to cure them but now they are good as new. So much easier than other methods of stripping diapers. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: megwheels

customer_reviews.title: My boys laundry was the worst and that is what I started on
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical at first when someone told me to use these to strip my laundry of build up odor and detergents and I must say...I am impressed. I soaked my clothing in bathtub with 3 packets at a time for a few hours and then rinsed them again in washer and ran a wash cycle after that and our clothes are coming out smelling fresh and clean with no odors that were stuck in them. My boys laundry was the worst and that is what I started on. I am so happy I found these. I have now ordered more so I can keep doing all our laundry.
customer_reviews.author: lisa labadie

customer_reviews.title: Hockey clothes finally didn't smell like... You know...
customer_reviews.text: Husband had issues with his hockey /athletic clothing he wears under his gear. No matter how many washings and soaks it still smelled like human swamp. Used this detergent and... magic! Use it on a load of already-washed items. I also used it on my sheets and pillow cases that started to have a smell.
customer_reviews.author: AggieJ

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Cloth DIapering
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laundry treatment because I was having problems with ammonia build-up in my cloth diapers, and it was causing rashes on my poor, little girl. So, I followed the directions completely, and within a couple of treatments, but diapers were good to go. Since I've been using the treatment once a month, I haven't had a problem with any build-up and my little girl's bum has stayed rash-free. It's definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Zort

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad that I tried this and will be using this ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything to get the stink out of some pre-owned cloth diaper inserts and nothing was working. Not hot water, not vinegar, not sunning, not Bac Out ... nothing. My local cloth diaper group suggested Mighty Bubbles and this got rid of the smell the first wash! I'm so glad that I tried this and will be using this for my cloth inserts and cloth diapers every now and then to prevent build up just to make sure they're fresh smelling.
customer_reviews.author: MarinaVanessa

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Ok y’all. My boyfriend is a chef and this is the ONLY THING that gets out that grease smell. I’ve tried oxyclean, ammonia, vinegar, borax, you make it. This is awesome. Leaves his chef uniform smelling fresh
customer_reviews.author: Kalin Alvey

customer_reviews.title: I am SO happy it got rid of my ammonia issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in desperate need of something that would fix my issue with ammonia in my diapers. I stripped twice and that didn’t help at all. I read the positive reviews on this and decided to give this a try. I used two treatments per 24 diapers and let me tell you, I am SO happy it got rid of my ammonia issue. Will definitely be buying more just to toss in the wash once a month or two!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: SO simple to use, definitely works.
customer_reviews.text: If you think you need to 'strip' your cloth diapers, I would recommend trying this product first instead! I had a bunch of inserts that were moderately repelling water. Washed them, then ran them through using one of these pods (according to the instructions) and the absorption of the inserts has very noticeably increased! I know this for a fact, because a few inserts didn't make it into the load that I treated with the Mighty Bubbles. '
customer_reviews.author: hmm253

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: GREAT BUY. so glad I got these instead of going to buy all the ingredients to strip my stuff myself. This was just convenient and affordable and it worked great! I stripped all my towels. We moved somewhere with hard water and everything is starting to get a build up. This strip made them feel brand new! So clean and no more weird smells! I will be reordering!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Gets ammonia OUT
customer_reviews.text: I actually use these for washing reusable puppy pads more often than for my cloth diapers, only because I don't cloth diaper full time but the puppy makes messes...full time. Ha! I had noticed that my puppy pads smelled horrible coming out of the wash without these, but with just one wash the ammonia smell is gone and they are fresh and ready to go again without stinking up the house.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L. Easley

customer_reviews.title: ... diapers that needed to be "stripped" and these were recommended. They came out smelling fresh afterwards
customer_reviews.text: I had stanky diapers that needed to be "stripped" and these were recommended. They came out smelling fresh afterwards, but after one use were back to the ammonia smell. So these didn't work as strong as I hoped. Unfortunately I think we're out of options and are nearing the end of cloth diaper use.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: ... to strip my used diapers using instructions from fluff love university's website
customer_reviews.text: I used this to strip my used diapers using instructions from fluff love university's website. It worked very well and my diapers came out so clean!!
customer_reviews.author: David+Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Leaking cloth diapers is the absolute worst. It only took one wash with 2 packets ...
customer_reviews.text: I had used a diaper rash cream with my cloth diapers when I first started my cloth diaper journey and it caused my diapers to repel. Leaking cloth diapers is the absolute worst. It only took one wash with 2 packets of Mighty Bubbles to get my diapers good as new. They are absorbing again and I haven't had any issues since. I know that I will need to eventually strip my diapers again and will definitely use Mighty Bubbles again.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: This did its job, although I had to run the diapers through twice with this. Those diapers were used, though, so I don’t know how they were cared for before we got them. The first pod kept our front loader from draining properly, but the second one worked fine, so I’m not sure what was up with the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Anne A.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work like i thought it would.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really work. I used the whole bag on 2 loads and some of my diapers still smelled funky. I soaked them in this as well. U have hard water so maybe this is why but I didn't see a difference in using this.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great for making sheets fresh again
customer_reviews.text: I used these to soak bed sheets and pillowcases in, to get rid of that old smell that you doesn’t wash out of sheets after you’ve had them awhile (especially where my husband sleeps). Worked great, they smell like new again!
customer_reviews.author: JandE

customer_reviews.title: Get directions on Pinterest
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This really cleaned our cloth diapers. I followed the directions found on pinterest, which is 3 pods in the stand-up washer for 8 hours in hot water. Then a thorough rinse. Diapers were like new!
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Gets linens sparkly white!
customer_reviews.text: The only product that gets my sons white blankie sparkly clean. We also love these for soaking our towels and bed linens to freshen them up and get them nice and white again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for stripping CD!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes yes yes!! Saw someone posted this to strip cloth diapers!! Yes!! I put 3 packets per strip overnight in hot water! Finally got over the barnyard smell. I tried all kids of these overnight remedies and nothing worked, but this! Buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Our cloth diapers were losing absorbency and I didn't want to try the bleach method so we got these. I did two washes and our diapers Are back to being fantastic! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fam Huynh

customer_reviews.title: CHEMICAL BURN, DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This caused a severe chemical burn - DO NOT BUY. Before use I contacted the company and they emailed with directions on how to use - I followed their direction, and the result is a SEVERE CHEMICAL BURN. I’ve never seen anything like it. This is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Cowabunga

customer_reviews.title: It Even Works On CLOTH PADS
customer_reviews.text: IT EVEN WORK ON CLOTH PADS. I been using "mama cloths" for years now and some of my more favorite or older cloths were stained and had an odor. I couldn't use bleach or fabric softener because of allergies and sensitive skin. So i tried these pods, washed my cloths a normal cycle with eco friendly detergent, then washed with these pods on hot/warm, added an extra rinse when that was done and then out came clean pads. Minimal to no staining, odor gone, and didn't irritate my skin. I use it monthly now with all my cloth pads.
customer_reviews.author: TED

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these packets! So much easier than making your own stripping formula. So easy to use a d strips diapers or other clothing just as well as a bathtub strip! Plus great price!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for stripping cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I needed to remove built up from my cloth diapers. We live in area with pretty hard water. These worked great for my prefolds ( I only added 1 pod per load)but for pocket covers I actually got better results with tide powder plus calgon..
customer_reviews.author: Sue Chi

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT use on colors
customer_reviews.text: If what you're washing is white, then you're probably fine. If it's anything with color, the color will run. I just put a shirt that I've had for a few years in a wash bin to soak, within seconds the water was the color of the shirt. I wanted to test it before using it in a whole load and I'm so glad I did! For white diapers this probably works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: they were ok
customer_reviews.text: its ok not great I think tide does just as good if not better but with these u rely do need to do several washes and rinses after to make sure u get it all out and did not take the stink out of the diapers very good not rely great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Khan

customer_reviews.title: Works for set in odor!
customer_reviews.text: My cloth stash had gotten an amonia smell no matter what I tried. Used these as directed once and the problem was solved. Have used again, about 2x a month and have had no more issues!
customer_reviews.author: A Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing invention.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I have hard water and have to use calgon every wash, I add two of these when I do my initial wash for my diapers and it helps clean and helps soften my water and prevent smells. Buy from here every 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Esmale

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, effective
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my baby's workhorse fitted diapers and they work great. Easy to use and effective. I follow the directions on the back of the package and haven't had any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Marie

customer_reviews.title: Gets Baby Pee Smell Out!
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler's blanket... been using it since birth. Has peed through so many diapers. This is the only product that gets the pee out. Not Tide, Wollite, or anything else. This is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Mike

customer_reviews.title: Gets rid of lingering diaper odors
customer_reviews.text: I use Thirsties cloth diapers and after a month of daily washing with Country Save detergent both the diapers and the water proof wraps had a slight lingering diaper smell. This stuff took that all away! I am very impressed and will add a monthly cycle with this wash to my diapering routine.
customer_reviews.author: ibarrasread

customer_reviews.title: Great for Stripping Towels
customer_reviews.text: Great for stripping towels. Amazing how much gunk came out of my towels when I stripped them using 2 Grovia Pods and a bathtub full of water. It was disgusting. After stripping, I washed and rinsed my towels as usual. They were fluffy, clean and great smelling again!
customer_reviews.author: cmanning3

customer_reviews.title: Effective & Economical!
customer_reviews.text: My wife was impressed with GroVia Mighty Bubbles; they're effective and worked great for my Wife when she needed to "strip" and "deep clean" our Baby's Cloth Diapers. We'll continue to use them every 6 weeks as recommended to refresh our diapers.
customer_reviews.author: MoncrieffFamily

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the best
customer_reviews.text: I've been using cloth diapers on my kid for five months. Started smelling a bit. Washed them once with tide original in hot water followed by a grovia wash. And the diapers are looking and smelling like how it was when I bought. Fresh and fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: Vasanth V

customer_reviews.title: Buy now!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good. Got a lot of nasty stuff out of my clothes with this!!! You can see the water color change. It's disgusting! Definitly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Hallee

customer_reviews.title: Due to having a bad wash routine I would get ammonia buildup after 3-4 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product that I can use that can strip my diapers. Due to having a bad wash routine I would get ammonia buildup after 3-4 months and this worked great! Throw a few in the wash and then do a bleach cycle and it's like hitting the reset button! This is my second purchase of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dara123

customer_reviews.title: Works great and my towels really smell fresh and clean now
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to get towel clean. My towels were smelly even though I had washed them. My daughter uses this sometimes for her cloth diapers and said I should try it on my towels and some other clothes. Works great and my towels really smell fresh and clean now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scented, so will not work to get clothes smell free if you have allergies to fragrance
customer_reviews.text: I got this to strip scent out of used clothes. It did not list anywhere online that it was strongly scented, but boy it was!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M

customer_reviews.title: Not so great...
customer_reviews.text: All it did was create bubbles. I didn't notice any good changes to my diapers. This actually made the diapers smell really weird. I did a cycle 3 times to. In the end I just bleach soaked and got the results I needed.
customer_reviews.author: AnnMarie

customer_reviews.title: In Love
customer_reviews.text: I used the stripping process recommended by Fluff University, along with this product, to get the best looking brand-new seeming diaper inserts ever. You'd never know they'd ever been used.
customer_reviews.author: Sofi

customer_reviews.title: Very wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Used for stripping cloth diapers. Got the job done!!! Ordered once in 2017 now 2018 and diapers need to be stripped again for deep cleaning, will be ordering again soon. Not recommend to strip cloth diapers a lot, but since it's been a year and diapers are still in great condition, but stripping for a deep clean. This product extracts deep into the cloth diapers to remove what the eye can not see.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: cloth diaper cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I got this solely for stripping my cloth diapers..it got my cloth diapers stripped and clean as other people have said along with a bit of bleach for disinfecting. I'm sure it could get nasties out of other things but I haven't tried it yet on my husbands work clothes which will probably need it soon .
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Apparently u have to strip your cloth diapers every once ...
customer_reviews.text: Apparently u have to strip your cloth diapers every once in a while which means using something to take all residues of detergent n minerals from urine n water, this product allows u to do that and not having to look for all kinds of stuff, u just use this pods n u are set
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I adore this product and the company. Not only is this fantastic for diapers, it works great for other smelly household items. Dog bed? Yes. Pillows? Yes. Clothes from grandmas who smokes? Yes. Awesome! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Jody R.

customer_reviews.title: These pods made my cloth diapers like-new!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to strip my stash of cloth diapers before the birth of baby #4, and these made them all like-new again. I also toss one into a load of diapers or towels on occasion to get rid of any build-up, and I can tell a real difference every time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Erin Wells

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works!!
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed. This stuff gets rid of the stink. I used it on some things my cat peed on. The smell is completely gone!! I'm using it on diapers right now. I can't wait to see how it does on those. If it can get cat urine out I have no doubt it will get the kiddo pee out no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Anna E.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to strip used cloth diapers that I bought. Worked well. Read directions and follow them well.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not HE safe for my washer, watch out!
customer_reviews.text: Caused suds to flow out of the emergency outlet at the top of my Kenmore HE washer (796 series) and run down into my basement. The worst part is that the washer/dryer are stacked and pushed back into a cabinet so it took us a while to see and realize what was happening. Really unpleasant. We were following the instructions on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Spiff

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Used this to give an extra clean to my laundry as I use a homemade laundry soap rather than a detergent. It seemed to help get the dingyness out of my clothes.
customer_reviews.author: J-me

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diaper WIN
customer_reviews.text: Works great either by following packaging instructions or by using Fluff Love University instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca White

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for al your cloth needs or deep cleaning gentle times. The only thing that I don’t like is having to use about 3 or washing a few times before I feel like it deep cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Tess S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for stripping cloth diaper
customer_reviews.text: Used to strip cloth diapers that I bought used and also used to strip ones I've had/been using. Was really impressed with how clean/new they felt afterwards. I wish there were more in a pack, but since I won't need to strip often I think the value it worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany McCrum

customer_reviews.title: Effective way to rid of bad smells.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would rid my baby’s diapers from the ammonia smell. I had mostly taken care of it by soaking them with icy clean but I feel like this was much less effort than soaking and in one wash it was done. Problem gone. They smell fresh again.
customer_reviews.author: Eze

customer_reviews.title: Love these pods!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my clothe diapers. I will throw one in the load about every other week. I don't like to wait for smells to set in before stripping. These work great!
customer_reviews.author: Mander

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well to reset my cloth diapers when I was battling ammonia due to a bad wash routine (and unknown hard water level at the time). Also great for towels.
customer_reviews.author: keisha albertson

customer_reviews.title: A life changer
customer_reviews.text: After doing the hard, tome consuming stripping diapers by hand task....and finding these packs, my life has forever changed. It so simple, literally just a normal wash for your diapers. No detergant, just 1 pack and bam!!! Your diapers are stripped. This is definitely a much needed add to any cloth diapering family
customer_reviews.author: Nila86

customer_reviews.title: These work great for stripping your cloth diapers which is what we ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great for stripping your cloth diapers which is what we had to do due to not knowing how to wash them correctly. Now we keep some on hand for just in case as well as stripping used diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Webb

product_meta.title: GroVia Mighty Bubbles Laundry Treatment for Baby Cloth Diapers (10 Count)
feature_bullets: DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY FOR CLOTH DIAPERS: This uniquely formulated powder treatment is used to remove buildup of urine and minerals from cloth diapers and garments. The pod will dissolve completely in the washing machine, but please NOTE this is NOT a detergent.

EASY TO USE: For use on clean cloth diapers. Place one pod in washer with diapers, no other detergent is needed. Run a regular hot wash with one extra rinse. Once diapers are clean of stains, return to a simple wash routine that uses enough detergent. Mighty Bubbles may be used in addition to a normal wash routine every several weeks to keep your diapers clean and buildup-free.
SAFE FOR USE: Made without ammonia, alcohol, ethers, and Phosphate. Safe for all washers, and is HE compliant.
NATURAL INGREDIENTS: Sodium carbonate, Sodium percarbonate, Sodium polyitaconate, Surfactants, Enzymes, Oxygen bleach activator, Sodium silicate
HIGH STANDARDS: Made in the USA and never tested on animals.
